wikipedia_page.main: Sir Robert Joseph Phillimore, 1st Baronet  (5 November 1810 – 4 February 1885), was an English judge and politician. He was the last Judge of the High Court of Admiralty from 1867 to 1875 bringing an end to an office that had lasted nearly 400 years.

response: Phillimore was the son of Sir Robert Phillimore, 1st Baronet, and of Charlotte Phillimore (née Denison). His mother was the sister of Evelyn Denison, 1st Viscount Ossington and of Edward Denison.

Phillimore was the son of Charles Augustus Phillimore, a partner at Coutts Bank. His father's cousin was the prominent judge Walter Phillimore, 1st Baron Phillimore, himself the son of the judge Sir Robert Phillimore, 1st Baronet and grandson of the lawyer Joseph Phillimore. He was educated at Eton College, where he was an Oppidan, and Christ Church, Oxford, where he took second-class honours in Greats. He was called to the bar by the Middle Temple in 1934. He was the pupil of Edward Pearce, and after his pupillage joined his chambers. He joined the Western circuit and acquired a varied practice.
